item.title: [Rework Idea] Mercenary
item.dc:creator: KyoDaz
item.description:
Good Idea Ashe, but I do not agree with the Neutral Killer class type. I’d put it into Neutral Offensive or back into Support.

All Neutral Killers should not be restricted to who they can kill and should be able to kill who they want and not someone else’s idea. It also messes with the “1 Neutral Killer Limit” thing. It’s win con also is not defeat an opposing faction which is what all NK’s are.

item.title: [Rework Idea] Mercenary
item.dc:creator: jabba
item.description:
Ultimately I see the change into rogue as an instant exe for BD if your contract dies early, as at that point in the game BD will not have enough information to know the evils exactly, and BD will ultimately be contracting to rando kill each other with the Rogue. Furthermore, if a merc goes rogue mid-game, BD will be hesitant in the first place to contract for rogue kills with limited info, and if the Rogue ends up killing a BD, he’s gonna get exe’d. If a merc is strapped for guards and his contract unfortunately dies late game, then there’s not going to be enough time in the rest of the game for him to get 3 contract kills. Obviously you could look at reducing the number of contract kills required to win, however rogue would inevitably be one of those neutral classes BD would immediately dispose of because it ultimately only hurts BD, like fool and scorned.

item.title: [Rework Idea] Mercenary
item.dc:creator: Ashe
item.description:
Note “Idea” as opposed to “Suggestion”, this isn’t something I feel needs to be added, just playing around with the idea of it, but that doesn’t mean I’m not looking for feedback. Also note that the Rogue’s abilities are disabled once they meet their win condition.

The Mercenary

Neutral Support
Looking For Work (Passive) - You have three days to find a contract, or you will commit suicide. If that contract dies, you will become The Rogue.
Contact Contract (Passive) - At night, you can talk with your contract, if you have one.
Offer Contract (Day) - Offer a contract to a player, if you do not already have one. - Infinite uses
Stand Guard (Night) - Protect your target and prevent others from visiting and make yourself immune to death for the night. - 4 uses
Rebound (Night) - Kill a player that accused your target of treason during the previous day. - 1 use
Contracted player survives.

The Sellsword

Unseen Support
Keeping in Contract (Passive) - At night, you can talk with the contract you had as a Mercenary, if you had one.
Stonewall (Night) - Protect an Unseen player and prevent other visitors from interacting with them. - 3 uses
Revenge (Night) - Kill target player that accused an Unseen member of treason the previous day. - 1 use
Defeat the Blue Dragon and any neutrals that seek to harm you.

The Rogue

Neutral Killer
Hardened (Passive) - Immune to death at night.
Contract Killing (Day) - Offer to kill for a player. They can choose a player for you to kill, or can deny the contract. - Infinite uses, can be used on the same day if denied
True Strike (Day) - Make your attack tonight pierce death immunity. - Infinite uses
Exterminate (Night) - Attack a player that you have been contracted to kill. - Infinite uses
Kill three contract targets. If you became a Rogue after Day 6, kill two contract targets, or if you became a Rogue after Day 9, kill a single contract target.
